titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Southey Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 04:14
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of letters and writings by Southey. Included are letters to James Ballantyne, Samuel Taylor Coleridge, John May, James Montgomery, and Sir Thomas Noon Talfourd. Writings include manuscripts of Amadis de Gaula; The Curse of Kehama; Roderick, the Last of the Goths; and of Robin Hood, written with his wife, Caroline Southey.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the box-and-folder list. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Robert Southey Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Southey Collection, General Collection. Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from previously existing cards in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, it has been noted in the box-and-folder list.

This finding aid will be updated periodically to account for new materials that may be added to the collection. The date of the most recent update is noted on the title page. For information on material that may have been added since the last update, please consult the Public Service Desk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to Robert Southey, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection. Materials incorporated into the collection prior to July 1997 have been organized into two series, Correspondence and Writings. Materials added to the collection since that time are located in Series III, Additions since July 1997, listed in the order in which they were added.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning Southey's work on the Edinburgh Annual Review

did.unittitle: 2 ALS to Thomas Foster Barham, Keswick
ALS to Mary Matilda Betham, Keswick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by engraved portrait of Southey

did.unittitle: ALS to Sir Egerton Brydges, Keswick
ALS to John Abraham Heraud, Keswick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Enclosed is a copy of Book II of his narrative poem Roderick, the Last of the Goths

did.unittitle: AL (with signature clipped off) to Mrs. [Mary Brent] Morgan, Keswick
ALS to [John Murray]- concerning Washington Irving and a proposed life Jeremy Taylor, Keswick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signature cut out, and the name of Robert Southey has been inserted in another hand; at the top of the first leaf in the autograph of Washington Irving, is the note, "From Robert Southey to John Murray"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Embodying an epitaph in memory of "Emma. . .", i.e. Emma (Chartres) Peachy

did.unittitle: Fragment of a note to Edward Quillinan, Keswick
2 ALS to E.S. Rickman, Norwich, England
AL, signed with initials, to John Rumney, Keswick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Written on subscription advertisement for his, A Chronological History of the West Indies, London, 1827

did.unittitle: 2 ALS to [Sir Thomas Noon Talfourd?], Keswick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by a small piece of paper containing a note in Southey's hand on the words "Porrage or porridge, and pottage"

did.unittitle: ALS to H.T. [Henry Taylor?] in which is mentioned slavery and the growth of democracy in America, Keswick
ALS to Charles Watkin Williams Wynn, Keswick
ALS to Henry B., West Tarring
ALS to an unidentified recipient, Keswick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: He thanks him for sending some statements on the Peninsular War

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by TLS from Kenneth Curry, Yale Ph.D. to Captain F.L. Pleadwell, former owner of the letters, Knoxville, Tennessee

did.unittitle: Amads de Gaula. English translation: Southey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Amadis of Gaul," by Vasco Lobeira: autograph manuscript of Robert Southey's translation of a prose romance, from the Spanish version of Garci Rodrguez de Montalvo;

did.unittitle: "Chimalpoca: A Monodrama Founded on an Event in the Mexican History"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript, signed "S" and endorsed "R.S.'s Autograph J.C."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript notebook containing miscellaneous notes, quotations, and some clippings, mainly on English literature and on Roman Catholicism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript, probably printers copy of the narrative poem; bookplates of James Cowan, Roderick Terry and Chauncey Brewster Tinker

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript, signed, of the poem beginning: "Moments there are in life, alas how few!", Keswick
Nelson: Autograph notes on Admiral Horatio Nelson
Notes on his readings in English history: autograph manuscript
Notes on the life of Henry Kirke White: autograph manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The notes are excerpts from the correspondence and commonplace books of White, whose memoir, written by Southey, was published in 1807

did.unittitle: "Recollections of the Early Life of Robert Southey, Written by Himself in a Series of Letters to his Friend Mr. John May"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript of portions of the autobiography, including parts of letters VIII, IX, X, XIII, XV Purchase, 1953

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript poem, Part I (2 copies); manuscript of Part II by his wife, Caroline Southey, and in her hand; accompanied by Southey's notes for the story of Robin Hood, 1808 Oct 28-1814 Jul 19; paper watermarked 1822

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript copy made for the printer

did.unittitle: "Roderick, the Last of the Goths": preface and other preliminary matter in the form of a letter addressed to James Ballantyne, the printer

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript of Book I of the narrative poem; title on ms: "Pelayo;" accompanied by photostats

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript notes and outlines of ideas for verse; paper watermarked 1824

did.unittitle: "State of Ireland" (i.e. "Ode written after the King's visit to Ireland"): Autograph manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Written on several small pieces of paper, pasted together and mended; 11 stanzas, with parts of stanzas 5, 7 and 8 missing; accompanied with a picture and clipping containing biography

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous manuscript fragments written in Southey's hand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by ALS from John Wood Warter to John A. Haslewood, dated 1856 Sep 24, concerning the manuscript fragments

did.unittitle: Amads de Gaula. English translation: Southey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Amadis of Gaul," by Vasco Lobeira: autograph manuscript of Robert Southey's translation of a prose romance, from the Spanish version of Garci Rodrguez de Montalvo;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript notebook containing miscellaneous notes, quotations, and some clippings, mainly on English literature and on Roman Catholicism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript, probably printers copy of the narrative poem; bookplates of James Cowan, Roderick Terry and Chauncey Brewster Tinker

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript poem, Part I (2 copies); manuscript of Part II by his wife, Caroline Southey, and in her hand; accompanied by Southey's notes for the story of Robin Hood, 1808 Oct 28-1814 Jul 19; paper watermarked 1822

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript copy made for the printer
